Uses of Package
syntax

  • Packages that use syntax 
    Package Description
    gui
    This package provides classes realizing the user interface and the handling of a user session in the program.
    semantics.ranking
    This package provides classes implementing ranking functions for propositional and first-order formulas and conditionals as well as system Z approaches to compute such ranking functions for a knowledge base.
    semantics.tolerancepair
    This package provides a data structure representing a tolerance-pair as well as different strategies to find tolerance-pairs for a knowledge base.
    semantics.worlds
    This package provides extensions of the possible world implementations in the Log4KR library.
    syntax
    This package provides all syntactic structures needed in addition to Log4KR, that is a data structure for first-order knowledge bases as well as other classes for formulas and groundings.
  • Classes in syntax used by gui 
    Class and Description
    RelationalKnowledgeBase
    A first-order knowledge base consists of a set of conditionals and a set of closed formulas, called facts.
    RelationalKnowledgeBaseReader
    This class can read a first-order knowledge base from a textual representation and checks whether it its a restricted first-order knowledge base.
  • Classes in syntax used by semantics.ranking 
    Class and Description
    GroundingOperator
    Extension of ConstraintBasedGroundingOperator, providing an unconstrained grounding operator with additional utility methods for simple instantiations.
    RelationalKnowledgeBase
    A first-order knowledge base consists of a set of conditionals and a set of closed formulas, called facts.
  • Classes in syntax used by semantics.tolerancepair 
    Class and Description
    GroundingOperator
    Extension of ConstraintBasedGroundingOperator, providing an unconstrained grounding operator with additional utility methods for simple instantiations.
    RelationalKnowledgeBase
    A first-order knowledge base consists of a set of conditionals and a set of closed formulas, called facts.
  • Classes in syntax used by semantics.worlds 
    Class and Description
    ExistentialQuantification
    Data structure for an existentially quantified formula.
    GroundingOperator
    Extension of ConstraintBasedGroundingOperator, providing an unconstrained grounding operator with additional utility methods for simple instantiations.
    UniversalQuantification
    Data structure for an universally quantified formula.
  • Classes in syntax used by syntax 
    Class and Description
    FullGroundSubstitution
    Extension of GroundSubstitution, adding the missing support for formulas of type Tautology.
    GroundingOperator
    Extension of ConstraintBasedGroundingOperator, providing an unconstrained grounding operator with additional utility methods for simple instantiations.
    Quantification
    Data structure for a quantified formula.
    RelationalKnowledgeBase
    A first-order knowledge base consists of a set of conditionals and a set of closed formulas, called facts.
